attributes.name: D. Event 4: Battle for the Pillar

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Ferrofluid Ooze|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Ferrofluid Ooze|engines_status}@{Ferrofluid Ooze|power_core_status}@{Ferrofluid Ooze|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The ferrofluid oozes hide among the equipment, emerging to attack once the PCs enter the room.

Morale The oozes fight until slain.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWyhMOr3mO-lZd5va8C_description
attribs.current: As a move action every [[1d4]] rounds, a ferrofluid ooze can move adjacent to a creature within its magnetic field that is either a technological construct or wearing or wielding technological equipment. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. The ooze then automatically attaches to that creature, as per the attach universal creature rule.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWyhlGBZ3tg6X2rtc7Y_description
attribs.current: If a ferrofluid ooze takes fire damage, any creature to which the ooze is attached is released. In addition, until the end of the oozes next turn, its magnetic field aura has no effect, and it cant use magnetic leap.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWyhs8nE3R0s3WaAZsP_description
attribs.current: A ferrofluid ooze is surrounded by a constant magnetic field that interferes with nearby technological equipment. Each time a creature within the field attacks with a technological weapon, it must succeed at a Strength check (DC = 11) or take a 2 penalty to its attack.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The sailpike follows the PCs vehicle, using its leaping skewer ability to attack foes.

Morale The sailpike flees if reduced to 5 Hit Points or fewer.

attribs.name: speed
attribs.current: 10 ft., Swim 50 ft. (500 ft. Charge with Leaping Skewer)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWyjQsLfLmJDm1IGiY7_description
attribs.current: A sailpike can swim up to 500 feet as part of a charge. When charging, the sailpike can leap up to 10 feet out of the water to attack any creature within 15 feet of the waters surface.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWyjWrMniquCErb6Ee7_description
attribs.current: A sailpike can use its winglike fins to catch strong winds and carry it to safety. As a swift action after using its leaping skewer ability, a sailpike can move 1d410 feet in a random direction. This movement provokes attacks of opportunity. A sailpike can use this ability only in winds that are severe or stronger.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Second Skin, Azimuth Laser Pistol with 1 Battery (20 Charges)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MX-TE1GGZRvpar2faQc_description
attribs.current: The laser pistol is possibly the most Common small arm used by explorers, guards, mercenaries, and traders. Laser pistols are light and reliable, yet they still deal a respectable amount of damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MX-TN948jKpBbkqSAyw_description
attribs.current: When the Groetan vandal's fully graviton-attuned, as a Standard Action, they can pull any number of creatures within 20 feet of them closer. They choose which creatures are affected and which ones arent. Each Target must succeed at a Fortitude save or be pulled 10 feet toward them. Solid objects do not block this ability, but any Creature that runs into a solid Object ceases Moving closer to them. Creatures moved by this ability do not provoke Attacks of opportunity from this movement. After they use this revelation, they immediately become unattuned. Black hole functions as a zenith revelation for the purposes of abilities that reference them.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The Groetan vandals use their black hole stellar revelations to pull PCs out of their vehicle and into the ocean, striking PCs with their solar weapons if in range or shooting with their pistols if not. If they struggle to damage the PCs, the vandals piloting the hovertrikes attempt to ram into the PCs vehicle.

Morale The Groetan vandals fight to the death as long as Tasuss survives. They flee the pillars if their leader falls or surrenders.

attribs.name: spells_menu
speed
attribs.current: 30 ft., Fly 20 ft. (Su, Average; In Space Only)

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Tasuss casts daze, shooting stars, and wisp ally to harass PCs who are attacking his allies.

Morale Tasuss fights to the death and surrenders only if the PCs destroy all the hovertrikes.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Second Skin, Azimuth Laser Pistol with 1 Battery (20 Charges), Survival Knife

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MX-UuwWdZ-om0eugBxM_description
attribs.current:
These light blades can be used for both mundane tasks and combat. A typical Survival knife has a fixed, single-edged, carbonsteel or ceramic blade and is treated against corrosion. 

Analog
This weapon does not use any advanced electronics, Computer systems, or electrical power sources. It is immune to abilities that Target technology. While this use of the word analogue is not technically correct when referring to technology, use of the term in this way has become Common throughout The Pact Worlds.

Operative
An Operative can use the trick Attack class feature with a weapon that has this special property. Any character can add her Dexterity Modifier rather than her Strength Modifier on melee Attack rolls with Weapons with this special property.

Thrown (20 ft.)
Ranged Weapons that must be thrown and melee Weapons that can be thrown as a Ranged Attack have the thrown special property and a listed Range Increment. You apply your Strength Modifier to damage rolls for thrown Attacks. After you throw a weapon, it lands near your Target and you must recover it if you want to Attack with it again.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MX-V4RK8BcO3al2AVUj_description
attribs.current: The laser pistol is possibly the most Common small arm used by explorers, guards, mercenaries, and traders. Laser pistols are light and reliable, yet they still deal a respectable amount of damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MX-VFQZ3O5Qs147M6UX_description
attribs.current:
Tasuss detect the surface thoughts of intelligent creatures around him. The amount of information revealed depends on how long he studies a particular area or target.

1st Round: Tasuss detects the presence or absence of thoughts from conscious creatures that have Intelligence scores of at least 1 (or an Intelligence modifier of 5) or higher.

2nd Round: Tasuss detects the number of thinking minds and the Intelligence score (or modifier) of each. If the highest Intelligence score is 26 (or a modifier of +8) or higher and at least 10 points higher than his own Intelligence score (or 5 points higher than his own Intelligence modifier), he is stunned for 1 round and the spell ends. This spell doesnt let him determine the location of the thinking minds if he cant see the creatures whose thoughts you are detecting.

3rd Round: Tasuss can read the surface thoughts of any mind in the area. A target who succeeds at its Will save prevents him from reading its thoughts, and he must cast detect thoughts again to have another chance. Creatures of animal intelligence (an Intelligence score of 1 or 2 or an Intelligence modifier of 4 or lower) have simple, instinctual thoughts.

Each round, Tasuss can turn to detect thoughts in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of dirt or wood, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or any force field blocks it.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MX-VNHAR-6KQF4iSuWw_target
attribs.current: One Humanoid Creature of CR 3 or Lower

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MX-VNHAR-6KQF4iSuWw_description
attribs.current: This spell short-circuits the mind of a humanoid creature with a CR of 3 or lower so that it is dazed (unable to take actions, but taking no penalty to AC). Humanoids of CR 4 or higher are not affected. After a creature has been dazed by this spell, it is immune to it for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MX-VROCOJmvZKYjqmPI_target
attribs.current: One Unattended Object of No More than 10 lbs. or 1 Bulk

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MX-VROCOJmvZKYjqmPI_description
attribs.current: Tasuss points his finger at the target object, gaining the ability to lift it and move it at will from a distance. As a move action, he can propel the object as far as 15 feet in any direction, though the spell ends if the distance between him and the object ever exceeds the spells range. He cant perform complex operations, such as firing a gun or using a computer, but he can shut a mechanical door or lid and work simple buttons to open or close automated doors or trigger an alarm.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MX-VWH09QI-FZZbPEMs_description
attribs.current: Tasuss links his mind to that of a touched creature to swiftly communicate a large amount of complex information in an instant. He decides what the target learns, limited to any amount of information that otherwise could be communicated in 10 minutes. This information comes in a series of visual images and emotional sensations, and it isnt language dependent.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MX-VdpWbeAundC4m2GL_target
attribs.current: Up to Three Creatures, No Two of Which Can Be More than 15 ft. Apart; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MX-VdpWbeAundC4m2GL_description
attribs.current:
Tasuss fires two missiles of magical energy that strike targets unerringly (the creatures must still be valid targets) and deal 1d4+1 damage each. He cant target specific parts of a creature, and objects are not damaged by the spell.

He can target a single creature or several creatures, but each missile can strike only one creature. He must designate targets before he attempt to overcome spell resistance or roll damage.

He can cast this spell as a full action. If he does, he fires three missiles instead of two.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MX-ViJuKZTv9Tk1p7rG_description
attribs.current:
Tasuss draws forth otherworldly energy to create a small, spherical, floating wisp that can distract his enemies in combat. This wisp can move 60 feet per round in any direction, and he can direct it as a move action on his turn. If the wisp occupies the same space as an enemy, the wisp provides his choice of either harrying fire or covering fire (see pages 246247) against the enemy each round on his turn, and it follows that enemy within range automatically unless he directs it to change targets. The wisp is made of pure light and energy and cant be damaged in combat, though it can be dispelled as normal.

In addition to the function described above, the wisp sheds light in a 20-foot radius in a colour of his choice (chosen when he casts the spell).

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MX-WrHCmRnbRdjqatCJ_description
attribs.current: If the target of this spell has 0 Hit Points and is dying, it automatically stabilizes. If the creature later takes damage, it is no longer stable.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MX-WssaEdQrzh3s1bGD_description
attribs.current: Tasuss flings an unattended object weighing up to 5 pounds (less than 1 bulk) at the target, making a ranged attack against its KAC. If he hits, you deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage to both the target and the object. The type of object thrown doesnt change the damage type or any other properties of the attack.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Second Skin, Azimuth Laser Pistol with 1 Battery (20 Charges), Mk 1 Frag Grenade

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MX-TE1GGZRvpar2faQc_description
attribs.current: The laser pistol is possibly the most Common small arm used by explorers, guards, mercenaries, and traders. Laser pistols are light and reliable, yet they still deal a respectable amount of damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MX-TN948jKpBbkqSAyw_description
attribs.current: When the Groetan vandal's fully graviton-attuned, as a Standard Action, they can pull any number of creatures within 20 feet of them closer. They choose which creatures are affected and which ones arent. Each Target must succeed at a Fortitude save or be pulled 10 feet toward them. Solid objects do not block this ability, but any Creature that runs into a solid Object ceases Moving closer to them. Creatures moved by this ability do not provoke Attacks of opportunity from this movement. After they use this revelation, they immediately become unattuned. Black hole functions as a zenith revelation for the purposes of abilities that reference them.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The Groetan devotees use their black hole stellar revelations to pull PCs out of their vehicle and into the ocean, striking PCs with their solar weapons if in range or shooting with their pistols if not. If they struggle to damage the PCs, the devotees throw frag grenades and pilot their hovertrikes attempt to ram into the PCs vehicle.

Morale The Groetan devotees fight to the death as long as Tasuss survives. They flee if their leader falls or surrenders.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MX1YrB36jP8CDISIA5d_description
attribs.current:
A fragmentary, or frag, grenade explodes in a cloud of shrapnel.

Explode (1d6 p, 15 ft.)
Explosives have the Explode special property, which lists the amount of damage the explosion deals, the damage type, special effects (with a duration, if necessary), and the radius of the explosion. When you Attack with this type of weapon or ammunition, aim at a grid intersection. Each Creature within the blast radius takes the listed damage but can attempt a Reflex saving throw for half damage. If you score a critical hit, it applies only to the Creature closest to the targeted intersection (you choose the Creature if several are equally close). If the Explode special property has any special effects other than damage, they are negated with a successful saving throw. Some exploding Weapons, such as smoke Grenades, don't deal damage, so they don't include the damage and damage type entries.

attribs.name: spells_menu
speed
attribs.current: 30 ft., Fly 20 ft. (Su, Average; In Space Only)

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat Tasuss activates his starlight form shortly before entering combat.

During Combat Tasuss casts daze, shooting stars, and wisp ally to harass PCs who are attacking his allies.

Morale Tasuss fights to the death and only surrenders if the PCs destroy all the hovertrikes.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Starlight Form (3 Minutes, DC 13), Walk the Void

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Graphite Carbon Skin, Static Arc Pistol with Battery (20 Charges), Tactical Duelling Sword

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MX-UuwWdZ-om0eugBxM_description
attribs.current:
While dueling swords are crafted to be aesthetically pleasing and are often seen as a mark of rank or tradition, many warriors still train with them to deadly Effect. 

Analog
This weapon does not use any advanced electronics, Computer systems, or electrical power sources. It is immune to abilities that Target technology. While this use of the word analogue is not technically correct when referring to technology, use of the term in this way has become Common throughout The Pact Worlds.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MX-V4RK8BcO3al2AVUj_description
attribs.current:
Arc pistols fire deadly, stunning blasts of electricity at Ranged Targets. They have a two-pronged emitter that directs the electrical blast and a bulky chamber that holds the capacitor.

Stun
You can set a weapon with the stun special property to stun mode (or reset it to Normal mode) as a Move Action. While in stun mode, all the weapon's Attacks are nonlethal.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MX-VFQZ3O5Qs147M6UX_description
